channel.title: [PI] opening urls?
channel.description:
So I added commands to open specific urls via server. But for some reason if they don't have an ending file type (like .html, .htm, .php, etc) they don't open.
The issue is I can't exactly get the file types and such for some links.
I believe this isn't an issue if you make the commands client sided, but I don't know for sure.
Anyone know how to fix this?

item.title: [PI] opening urls?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“The7thSanctum, post:5, topic:526230”]You don’t need to mention the .html extension.
“http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,644971” works just fine.[/quote]
So that’s why they don’t open why I use the command? Weird.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] opening urls?
item.dc:creator: @The7thSanctum The7thSanctum

@The7thSanctum wrote:

You don’t need to mention the .html extension.

item.title: [PI] opening urls?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Coldmedicine:

What do you mean?

a link like this would work:

		if (playerCommand.equals("forums")) {
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,644971.0.html", 12000);
		}

But a link like this wouldn’t:

		if (playerCommand.equals("forums")) {
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/", 12000);
		}

Read full topic

So I added commands to open specific urls via server.
But for some reason if they don’t have an ending file type (like .html, .htm, .php, etc) they don’t open.
